comment: Lauren is a good professor. She is more than fair in grading. And as long as you attend class, there is a lot of extra credit. She also cancels class a lot, which is nice. 4 papers, no tests, 3 discussion posts, and one quiz every week. I thought the lectures were really boring, but I still learned a lot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: You have weekly reading quizzes, 3 or 4 discussion posts, and 3-5 page papers to write over the books. She is very fair about how she handles student issues. You'll know about extra credit and what to expect upfront; there will be no surprises. Overall, an excellent teacher, especially for those wanting to expand their horizons.

Lauren is a great professor! There are no tests, just 4 papers (3-5 pages) that are not difficult, 3 discussion posts, and weekly online reading quizzes (about 5 questions) that are all easy 100s. She is very fair and gives you lots of chances to get an A! Definitely take her if you get the chance!

Professor Alford is really easy. Show up to class because you're only allowed like 6 absences. Class is all discussion but mainly her talking. You go into detail about gender, love and sex (obviously). Only 3-4 papers 3-5 pages long, very easy. Weekly reading quizzes due, usually  5 questions and easy. This class is a great for gen ed!! TAKE IT!lo
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Prof Alford is passionate about the subject and very knowledgeable. In class she leads great, interactive and engaging discussions. Surely one of the better Profs I've had at KSU. She is fair and gives every opportunity to make an A. Don't blow off the work and you won't have any problems. I took it as an elective and would recommend it!

There's 10 or so reading quizzes, 4 papers, 3 discussion posts, and a presentation. You can only miss 3 classes before being penalized. SHE DOES NOT TAKE LATE WORK UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCE (even emergencies)! It's an easy course if you just show up to class. Professor Alford is great and I would take her course again. She's a lenient grader.

Such an amazing teacher and really enjoys teaching this course. There are really short 5-10 question reading quizzes due before class. They are straight from the book and won't take you more than 1520 mins. One in class presentation, very easy . I would Highly recommend this class and love Prof. Alford!

Professor Alford was great. Took her during the summer semester.  You could tell that she was interested in the subject & loved teaching. As for the work load: 3 short discussion posts, 5-10 question reading quizzes each class,  a 5 min. presentation, and 4 (3-4 page) papers over related materials. Watched movies and had discussions during class.

Her class was amazing!! Class and participation are 20% of you grade, no tests just papers, and weekly quizzes and discussion posts. As long as you do all of the work you will get an A! She is not boring and talks about very interesting topics!
Very easy assignments and quizzes. No tests. Essays are a little tricky because she doesn't give you much to go on, but the classes are interesting.

Professor Alford is absolutely amazing. I loved her class because she opens up the floor for discussions and opinions all the time. We have weekly readings and quizzes but theyre not hard at all. There are no tests; just 4 essays. The essays are mainly opinion based, so you cant really fail them unless you just dont do them.
